Please provide if GitHub discussion supports the following features:

1. Global organization discussions, available for org only
2. discussion per repository
3. search capabilities to look for specific issue
4. possible limitations per amount of discussions
5. labelling/tags/mentioning in the discussions: is it possible to create custom tags or labels and add specific teams to monitor tag or label
6. capabilities to group discussion by categories
7. licensing model

Join GitHub as we explore how the SPACE framework, Innersourcing, GitHub Codespaces and GitHub Copilot can all contribute towards a more seamless developer experience.

content.body:
# Welcome to the Revenue organization ü•≥ We're so glad you're here! This checklist is designed to complement the live sessions you'll be attending. We know there's a lot of information to absorb, so we've structured the checklist into different parts to ensure you get the most out of the live session week. Be sure to check off your completed tasks as you go along. We encourage you to complete each part after the corresponding live session. Taking it step by step will help you absorb the material more effectively. **Use the links below to jump to a specific section:** - [Session 1: Welcome to Revenue](#session-1-welcome-to-revenue) - [Session 2: GitHub essentials](#session-2-github-essentials) - [Session 3: Discover our products](#session-3-discover-our-products) - [Session 4: Understand our customers](#session-4-understand-our-customers) - [Session 5: Competitive insights](#session-5-competitive-insights) - [Continued learning](#continued-learning) - [Additional resources](#additional-resources) - [Revenue onboarding feedback](#revenue-onboarding-feedback) ## Session 1: Welcome to Revenue Thank you for joining our **Welcome session**! Now, let's make sure you have everything you need for Revenue. Enroll in and access the essential tools listed below, some of which were mentioned in the session. Other tools may be required; check with your buddy or manager to ensure you have all the necessary resources for your role. ### Revenue tool kit - [x] **Rewatch:** Recorded sessions are stored in Rewatch, and you will need access to watch the videos. Reach out to IT, let them know you're new, and request access to Rewatch. - [x] **Internal Knowledge Management System:** We use **Guru** as our knowledge-sharing platform. You can quickly access Guru from your Okta dashboard. Use the **Ask a Question** button for quick searching within our knowledge base. Want to learn more about Guru? Here's [a brief overview](https://app.getguru.com/card/igKanG9T/What-is-Guru). - [x] Subscribe to the [Revenue Enablement calendar](https://calendar.google.com/calendar/u/0?cid=Z2l0aHViLmNvbV80dGM1ZDZodTVla2xhcDRxMHM3Z3N1ZWNoMEBncm91cC5jYWxlbmRhci5nb29nbGUuY29t) for access to our regularly scheduled office hours and Revenue Weekly Live. You are also welcome to join any Revenue Onboarding sessions as refresher courses. - [x] **Google Calendar:** Update your work hours in your settings. Utilize *Focus Time* and *Out of Office* to help keep your calendar up to date. - [x] Create an [Access Request Issue](https://github.com/github/business-systems/issues/new/choose) to request access to any tools you'll need. Check in with your buddy for help filling out this form and guidance around which tools you'll need. Don't forget to @mention your manager to approve your access request in the issue. **Note:** This request may have been sent by your manager, so please make sure before opening a request. - [x] **Slack:** Configure helpful apps on Slack. We recommend the following: - Google Calendar - Google Drive - Zoom Get to know our friendly bots: - Hubot: One of our helpful GitHub bots. - OctoBot: Your direct (but not private) line to IT. This is also a good opportunity to organize your channels, as you will be invited to many more along the way. ### Resources Get to know the Revenue organization and your team better with the links below. Throughout your onboarding, you will receive many links. We recommend bookmarking them as you go so you can easily reference them later. - [x] Visit our [Revenue org chart](https://thehub.github.com/org/?login=eanderson) on The Hub to familiarize yourself with other Revenue teams. - [x] Find your team's repo and review their "README" to get to know your team better. If your team is not listed, reach out to your buddy to ask for additional links to review. - [revenue-enablement](https://github.com/github/revenue-enablement) - [sales-operations](https://github.com/github/sales-operations) - [solutions-engineering](https://github.com/github/solutions-engineering) - [services](https://github.com/github/services) - [customer-success](https://github.com/github/customer-success) - [support](https://github.com/github/support) - [gtm-program-management](https://github.com/github/gtm-program-management) - [market development](https://github.com/github/market-development) - [technology-partnerships-and-engineering](https://github.com/github/technology-partnerships-and-engineering) - [sales-development](https://github.com/github/sales-development) ### Revenue comms - [x] As the name suggests, the Revenue Weekly Bulletin gets posted every week in [#revenue](https://github.slack.com/archives/C0EUM70MB) as well as in the [github/revenue](https://github.com/github/revenue/discussions/categories/weekly-bulletin) repo. - [x] Almost every week, the Revenue enablement team will host a "Revenue Weekly" Session. You should automatically be invited to attend the session.All recordings and notes will be posted to Guru (search `Revenue Weekly` in Guru). - [x] Every month, there will be a Product Roadmap session hosted by the Product Marketing team. All discussions are documented in the [github/revenue](https://github.com/github/revenue/discussions/categories/product-revenue?discussions_q=category%3A%22Product+%3C%3E+Revenue%22+label%3Aproduct-roadmap) repo. You can also search for `product roadmap` in Guru. - [x] ‚ú® **Markdown** ‚ú® is an easy-to-use syntax for styling text on GitHub and beyond. We highly encourage you to practice using it! Click [here](https://github.com/github/revenue-onboarding/blob/main/docs/continued-learning.md#get-to-know-markdown) for more information on getting to know Markdown. You'll also want to make sure you: - [x] Confirm with your manager or buddy to ensure you're included in all appropriate team communication groups and channels (Gmail, Slack, and GitHub) - [x] Shadow, shadow, shadow! Start jumping into meetings that will help you start hearing and learning the lingo. - [x] Introduce yourself to Hubbers on your team via Slack and invite them to a "Meet & Greet" with you using Google Calendar and the [Zoom integration](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/360020187492-Using-the-Zoom-for-Google-Workspace-add-on#h_01G3YB5JERS72V97G8JNXRKAKG). Start with your manager and buddy! > **Note** > Need help taming your GitHub notifications? [Click here](https://github.com/github/revenue-onboarding/blob/main/docs/continued-learning.md#notifications) to learn more! **Did you miss the live session?** We know that working in a global environment means live session times may not always suit your schedule. You can rewatch recordings of any of our sessions. Here is the link to rewatch our [Welcome to Revenue](https://app.getguru.com/card/izpMooeT/Welcome-to-GitHub-Revenue) session. > [!IMPORTANT] > Make sure to log into Rewatch and Guru for the video to play properly. Build a foundational understanding of GitHub products by taking our Product 101 courses. Each course is approximately 30 minutes. You may take them at your own pace, but be sure to complete them before your next onboarding session. You may self-enroll using the links below: - [x] [GitHub Platform 101](https://github.learnupon.com/catalog/courses/3926754) - [x] [GitHub Actions 101](https://github.learnupon.com/catalog/courses/3926730) - [x] [GitHub Copilot 101](https://github.learnupon.com/catalog/courses/3926755) - [x] [GitHub Advanced Security 101](https://github.learnupon.com/catalog/courses/3866072) You've completed the checklist for Session 1. The next sessions may not occur immediately, so bookmark this checklist and refer back to it as needed. In the meantime, take the opportunity to explore our resources, familiarize yourself with the team, and start engaging with the tools and platforms available to you. ## Session 2: GitHub essentials Thank you for attending the **GitHub Essentials** session! Now that you‚Äôve learned the fundamental tools and practices needed to effectively use GitHub, it‚Äôs time to reinforce your knowledge. Complete the tasks provided to get hands-on experience and deepen your understanding of GitHub‚Äôs key features, best practices, and essential workflows. - [x] Continue learning and practicing markdown. Check out GitHub's [Basic formatting syntax](https://docs.github.com/en/get-started/writing-on-github/getting-started-with-writing-and-formatting-on-github/basic-writing-and-formatting-syntax) doc to learn best practices of markdown. - [x] Work with your buddy and team to learn how they communicate within GitHub and other tools across the organization. - [x] Check out [how we write at GitHub](https://github.com/github/brand/blob/main/docs/how-to-write-at-github.md#this-is-how-we-write-at-github) to learn more about GitHub's voice. *Want to learn more?* - [x] At GitHub, collaboration is key! That's why understanding how to use issues and pull requests is vital. But don‚Äôt worry, we‚Äôve got you covered with our GitHub Skills course. This course takes you beyond the basics covered in the GitHub essentials session, and in under an hour, you'll deepen your skills. Head over to this link: [Introduction to GitHub](https://github.com/skills/introduction-to-github). You've completed the checklist for Session 2. Make sure to join the "Discover Our Products" live session before starting Section 3. Did you miss this live session? Click [here](https://app.getguru.com/card/iA9Kxp4T/GitHub-Essentials) for information on what's included in **GitHub Essentials**. ## Session 3: Discover our products Thank you for attending our **Discover Our Products** session. To get more familiar with our products, check out demos with the links below: - [x] [GitHub Platform demo](https://youtu.be/Hpx4Zlu8ujk) - [x] [GitHub Advanced Security demo](https://app.getguru.com/card/ibaRMGnT/GHAS-and-AI-Walkthrough-Video-external) You've completed the checklist for Session 3. Make sure to join the "Understand Our Customers" live session before starting Section 4. Did you miss this live session? Click [here](https://app.getguru.com/card/iXnpzXgT/Discover-Our-Products) for information on what's included in **Discover Our Products**. ## Session 4: Understand our customers Thank you for attending our **Understand Our Customers** session. Learn more about our customers with the links below. - [x] Review our [Buyer Personas Index](https://docs.google.com/presentation/d/1W4N0tW1SGR-AaOVu9DCQ7nI7kex5wfwPAiREEZr2YIs/edit#slide=id.g1347f96b7a1_0_364) to get a better understanding of our top customer personas. You've completed the checklist for Session 4. Make sure to join the "Competitive Insights" live session before starting Section 5. Did you miss this live session? Click [here](https://app.getguru.com/card/T6xpjoKc/Understand-Our-Customers) for information on what's included in **Understand Our Customers**. ## Session 5: Competitive insights Thank you for attending our **Competitive Insights** session. This section is still üöß under construction. Visit [here](https://app.getguru.com/card/Toq6R68c/Competitive-Insights) for information on what's included in **Discover Our Products**. ## Continued learning We want to make sure you know where product resources are located, so we've included some handy links below. If you're in a customer-facing role, ask your buddy which resources will be most valuable for your onboarding journey.
Click here for a list of links to product resources ### GitHub Platform Story - Enroll in our [Platform Story course](https://github.learnupon.com/catalog/courses/3374107) on LearnUpon to learn more about how we present our platform and core messaging to our customers. - Enroll in our [GitHub Platform scenario practice - Software & digital edition](https://github.learnupon.com/catalog/courses/3685052) course to learn more about how to customize the GitHub Platform story based on a customer's unique situation. ### Revenue Play Guides Enroll in the following Revenue Play Guide courses: - [Lead with Copilot](https://github.learnupon.com/catalog/courses/3635025) - [Increase Copilot Adoption](https://github.learnupon.com/catalog/courses/3656970) - [Displace GitLab to land new customers](https://github.learnupon.com/catalog/courses/3699447) - [Land new customers from Bitbucket Server](https://github.learnupon.com/catalog/courses/3699548) - [Build GHAS pipeline faster with the GHAS Outreach Accelerator](https://github.learnupon.com/catalog/courses/3708826) ### Other courses - Enroll in [GitHub's Consumption Business](https://github.learnupon.com/catalog/courses/3646722) course to learn more about what‚Äôs changing, why it‚Äôs happening, and how these changes will impact our relationships with customers in the coming quarters. ### Security overview - [GitHub Advanced Security (GHAS) Guru Collection](https://app.getguru.com/collections/dphx9/GHAS) - [GitHub Service Continuity Management Plan (BCDR)](https://app.getguru.com/card/T7ajRLnc/GitHub-Service-Continuity-Management-Plan-BCDR) ### Competition in security - [GHAS Competitive Information](https://app.getguru.com/card/TAaqbzMc/Competitive-Overview-for-GHAS) ### GitHub Actions - [Product Marketing Assets for Actions](https://app.getguru.com/card/iAqLpkpT/GitHub-Actions-Documentation-Index) - [Actions explanation for a non-technical audience](https://app.getguru.com/card/T487KgKc/GitHub-Actions-Fundamentals-For-nontechnical-audience-internal-learning-purposes) - [Actions info for technical delivery](https://app.getguru.com/card/cB5KXXRi/GitHub-Actions-Technical-Overview-For-internal-learning-purposes) ### Competition in CI/CD - [Actions Competition](https://app.getguru.com/card/i78oMyET/GitHub-Actions-Competitive-Analysis-GitLab-Circle-Travis-Jenkins) - [GitHub Package Registry competitive analysis](https://github.com/github/c2c-package-registry/blob/main/docs/competitive-analysis.md) Corresponding Slack channels that you can join: - [#advanced-security-sales](https://github.slack.com/archives/CNG82545A) for GHAS sales related questions and discussions - [#customer-security-trust](https://github.slack.com/archives/C8YQB194Y) field enablement for anything security and compliance related - [#customer-incident-response](https://github.slack.com/archives/C016QJCFNP8) for security incident related announcements, and security related responses - [#security](https://github.slack.com/archives/C0DSSTST0) for general GitHub security related conversations - [#smg-actions](https://github.slack.com/archives/CNXKRE8CB) for C2C
For those in technical roles, we've provided more readings [here](https://github.com/github/revenue-onboarding/blob/main/docs/continued-learning.md#technical-knowledge). ## Additional resources Here's a handy checklist of resources to bookmark: - [x] Bookmark [GitHub Notifications](https://github.com/notifications) - [x] Bookmark [GitHub Issues](https://github.com/issues/assigned) - [x] Bookmark [The Hub](https://thehub.github.com) - [x] Bookmark [Guru](https://app.getguru.com/dashboard) ## Revenue onboarding feedback We want to hear from you! ü´µ - [x] At the end of the last session on competitive insights, we provided [this feedback form](https://forms.gle/8nG9D7fPQzqGcE6CA). After attending the onboarding sessions and reviewing all related materials, please take a moment to complete it. Your insights are invaluable and will help us enhance our onboarding process. ## Congratulations üèÜ You've finished the Revenue onboarding checklist! Your onboarding journey doesn't stop here. See the comment below for next steps. If you're a fan of taking deep dives into different topics, you can visit this [doc](https://github.com/github/revenue-onboarding/blob/main/docs/continued-learning.md) for continued learning. *If you have any questions, reach out in your onboarding cohort's Slack thread or [#revenue-enablement](https://github.slack.com/archives/C02H7LZB58T).* ‚ù§Ô∏è Cc: @dassencio
content.title: Revenue organization onboarding for @rulasg

content.body: So you survived your first day, @rulasg! Congratulations! We hope you aren't too overwhelmed. Here at GitHub, we aim for just the right level of whelm. ### Security checkup OK, we *know* that the first day is overwhelming. That's why we're reiterating security in this issue. You already did some of these, but by the end of the week, please make sure all of the following are checked off: - [x] Strong password on github.com (saved in 1Password or other secure method) - [x] Two factor authentication on your github.com account - [x] Set up a hot corner or learn the keyboard shortcut (‚åÉ+‚áß+‚èè or ‚åÉ+‚áß+‚åΩ) to lock your screen - On a MacBook with Touch Bar, you can add a Screen Lock button under System Preferences -> Keyboard -> Customize Control Strip. - [x] Make sure you've setup access to your @microsoft.com account. You should receive a temporary password from your manager and can then follow these setup instructions. To find your @microsoft.com username, log in to Workday, click on your Profile Picture, select View Profile, select Personal and under Microsoft Fields you will see column Microsoft Alias. - [x] Complete any assigned Security training in [Viva Learning](https://github.okta.com/app/bookmark/0oa1kqms7krpYHcHY1d8/login) (requires the @microsoft.com to login) - [x] If you havent already, please take some time to fill out the IT Onboarding Survey to assist the IT team in creative ways to improve - https://forms.gle/Q7HwqgTiX8ibz6iG8 - [x] If you plan on using an Apple ID, please create one using your GitHub email address - [x] Review the general security guide ### For your phone! - Please feel free to use the mail app of your choice for your GitHub.com email on whatever device you have. When you set it up, just choose the Google option and follow the prompts. You will need to set up [Okta Verify](https://thehub.github.com/it/how-to/set-up-and-use-okta-verify/#use-okta-fastpass-on-mobile) on your mobile device as a 2-factor authentication method for Okta, if you have not already. ### Other stuff - Ask your buddy if you need `stafftools`, `devtools` or `biztools` access. Typically this is only necessary for Support, Engineering, and Operations staff. Please read [this article](https://thehub.github.com/engineering/security/entitlements/stafftools-entitlements/) for more information on how to request access. ### Further reading There is a ton of useful information on TheHub. When in doubt, feel free to reach out and ask a question. Also, a lot of hubbers find the information they are looking for by searching GitHub and/or Slack channels. If you do find an answer to your question, and it's not written down anywhere, please start a new guide on [TheHub](https://github.com/github/thehub). **The guide doesn't need to be pretty!** The most important thing is that it gets written down so that others can find it. cc @dassencio
content.title: @rulasg: Your first week at GitHub

Date: Thursday, 12 September 2024 at 20:32

Subject: Hey Ra√∫l! You‚Äôve just been enrolled in 'GitHub‚Äôs Consumption Business'

We‚Äôve just enrolled you in a course on LearnUpon called GitHub‚Äôs Consumption Business. To take this course, you can either click your Okta tile or log on to: [https://github.learnupon.com/](https://github.okta.com/home/github_learnupon_1/0oa1ltwbtx73Bpjz81d8/aln1ltwh6mcOoobzU1d8)

Happy learning!

The Revenue Enablement Team 

Please do not reply to this message as we will be unable to answer you. Instead, find us on Slack at [#learnupon-support](https://github.slack.com/archives/C04BQVBSP7W).

content.body:
## Overview 

Providing @rulasg @zbazztian additional resources for their onboarding experience. 

## Demo Materials 
- [Copilot Demo Recordings](https://app.getguru.com/card/ipAydqoT/List-of-Copilot-Demos-by-SEs-Ent-Advocates-CSAs)
- [GHAS Technical Demo Recordings](https://app.getguru.com/card/T4ArR75c/GHAS-Frequently-Asked-Questions-Demos)

## Recent Product Enablement 

- [All Office Hours](https://github.rewatch.com/collection/1323/office-hours): Compilation of all Office Hours 
- [Copilot Office Hours](https://github.rewatch.com/collection/18337/github-copilot-office-hours): Weekly office hours with focus topics 
- [Proxima](https://app.getguru.com/card/cLRKEnLi/Private-GA-GHEC-with-Data-Residency-Field-and-Enablement-Assets): All enablement assets relating to Proxima (externally known as GHEC with Data Residency) including this [video](https://app.getguru.com/folders/c49RKGki/GHEC-Data-Residency-Proxima?activeCard=2abcc0e6-50b4-4239-a4e6-bb67d1878179)
- [Depths Uncovered Series Folder](https://github.rewatch.com/collection/75709/depths-uncovered-technical-product-enablement-series): Field Services specific trainings with PMs on hand picked technical topics (determined by Product Directors, Jamie) 
  - [Session 1](https://github.rewatch.com/video/z4i9efcbv0e4d7ko-depths-uncovered-series-field-services-technical-deep-dive-session-june-12-2024): Security Products Configurations, Autofix, Enterprise Teams
  - [Session 2](https://github.rewatch.com/video/ykvis2x5dr97yr12-depths-uncovered-series-field-services-technical-deep-dive-session-on-ghe-ghas-metered-august-5-2024): GHAS Metered Billing, GHE Metered Billing
  - [Session 3](https://github.rewatch.com/video/s4hc1brh5g5k5crl-depths-uncovered-copilot-deep-dive-accelerate-september-12-2024): Copilot ENT Story, Mixed Licenses, Code Review, Custom Models, Copilot Workspace

content.body:
<@U043TV8JKEU> Sorry, my mistake. The rules recently changed and I forgot. Since you're based in Spain, you must get a GitHub Corporate AMEX card, not a Microsoft one. Also, you will still continue submitting expenses in Expensify, while <@UP7UAV3NH> needs to use Microsoft's MyExpense instead.

These are the instructions for you <@U043TV8JKEU>: <https://thehub.github.com/guides/expenses/american-express-policy/#how-to-request-a-github-corporate-american-express-card>

[Slack Message](https://github.slack.com/archives/C07MXR083V1/p1726664153084379)

content.body:
PS: [The video](https://github.rewatch.com/video/s4hc1brh5g5k5crl-depths-uncovered-copilot-deep-dive-accelerate-september-12-2024) shared by 
[@jendadd](https://github.slack.com/team/U06PV5XFGEB)
 is worth watching. She brought Copilot Enterprise PMs together to present about the future of the product and answer questions. It‚Äôs not ‚Äúeverything we need to succeed‚Äù, but a valuable first step in the right direction. Let‚Äôs encourage more of that.

content.body:
Certification about Copilot

https://docs.google.com/document/d/1I-G9ERMOwteZ-SQXpZ0PVH39T9oULc2ybAUIDjyJVxQ/edit?usp=sharing

Resource to demo Copilot ( Marco Bergami)

- https://github.com/octodemo/geektrainer-demo-conference

**CE Demo**
Use GeekTrainer‚Äôs repo to demo
Use the hub‚Äôs knowledge base to showcase a url shortener scenario to demo knowledge bases
Ask what‚Äôs the latest version of python available an see if it triggers the Bing search
Use PR diff to ask about code changes
Show Autofix AI capabilities

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/08d8eb94-6487-402b-b95d-19fa48738eca)
![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/a6895703-a857-43da-bd99-e572f9276704)


**Flow**
- Go to issue
- Read issue
- Explain that a lot of time would be spent looking to see where those files are
- Ask Copilot
- Where are talks submitted and edited in this app ? (Say that we are not using technical language or directory names‚Ä¶ simply natural language)
- Open up views.py through source link reference
- Role play that I am new to the code, or it‚Äôs been a few months
- Select line 7 and click suggest improvements
- Wanting to see code duplication information
- Go back and have it now explain what the code is doing
- Ask upon the explanation: How do I display a success message when a talk is submitted ?
- Say that without copilot, the web may just give you generic examples, copilot helps you stay in the zone
- Given it will speak of the messages framework, now ask: What is the Django messages framework ?
- Say that you can ask questions not only about your repository, but external topics, and current topics ‚Äî could also ask here: -What is the latest Python version to see if it would trigger the Bing search
- Accessibility (knowledge bases)
- Go into immersive mode just for fun
- Search for the ‚ÄúWeb Development‚Äù knowledge base
- Show that it was trained on 4 repositories that are helpful to what I am doing
- Ask: How do I make Bootstrap alerts accessible ?
- Highlight references
- Now ask: How could I migrate from Bootstrap 4 to 5 ?

content.body:
From: Roberto Gonzalez Sagredo (HE | HIM) <[rgonzal@microsoft.com](mailto:rgonzal@microsoft.com)>
Sent: Thursday, October 3, 2024 9:19 AM
To: Oana Dinca <[oanamariadinca@github.com](mailto:oanamariadinca@github.com)>; Veronica Ayora Estevan <[veronicaa@microsoft.com](mailto:veronicaa@microsoft.com)>; Jose Manzaneque <[jmanzaneque@microsoft.com](mailto:jmanzaneque@microsoft.com)>; Nacho Sanchez Gines <[nachos@microsoft.com](mailto:nachos@microsoft.com)>
Subject: Caso GitHub abierto por Iberdrola: 3030406
Importance: High
 
Buenas Oana,
 
No s√© si hay que incluir a alguien m√°s de GH, sino dime o incl√∫yelo tu misma.
 
Iberdrola ha abierto un caso, con ID 3030406, del que yo como CSAM no tengo visibilidad.
No s√© si me pod√©is incluir en el hilo de correo de soporte, para estar actualizado y ver la respuesta que se da a Iberdrola.
 
El escenario es √©ste;
. A continuaci√≥n, a√±ado un diagrama que quiz√° deje el escenario m√°s claro:

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/a39d1420-3388-44ad-af49-9300604bb6bb)

El caso que tenemos es que queremos utilizar una Action de Github hecha por Microsoft, pero que te obliga a tener configurado un Service Principal, problema porque hay que manejar secretos, o que tengas una VM en Azure y que con esa identidad accedas al Synapse, que tampoco gusta.
 
 
Por favor, es medianamente urgente poder dar una respuesta, la que sea, sea algo que se pueda hacer, o no, pero nos gustar√≠a que nos ayudaseis a que la tuvieran cuanto antes.
 
 
Saludos, Regards
Roberto Gonzalez Sagredo (HE | HIM)
Customer Success Acct Manager
Mobile: [+34 682 379 035](tel:+34682379035)
[rgonzal@microsoft.com](mailto:rgonzal@microsoft.com)
content.title: Iberdrola - Support - Auth using Azure/Synapse-workspace-deployment

On Tuesday, Oct 01, 2024 at 12:44 PM, JOSE LUIS ALCAZAR NOVILLO <[joseluis.alcazar.tech@bbva.com](mailto:joseluis.alcazar.tech@bbva.com)> wrote:
Hi Alan,
I have a question about the unaffiliated users that appear in the People roles section (screenshot attached) 
As a result of some users' external operations, sometimes an user is forced to leave an organization, so it goes outside the orgs, but with a github license though.

The questions are : 
can we use any API to get these unaffiliated users?
How cand we query the api to get these "orphan users"?

We're trying to automate the deletion of these users.

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/86d68d88-00b3-4a85-88fe-be35265aad6f)

Greets


---------

Jos√© Luis Alc√°zar Novillo

Phone +34 608905958 ‚Äì [joseluis.alcazar.tech@bbva.com](mailto:joseluis.alcazar.tech@bbva.com)
GSD - Engineering - Europa, Planta 2, Ciudad BBVA

content.body:
# Meeting with client 241008

epradocl@emeal.nttdata.com, Jose Manzaneque <jmanzaneque@microsoft.com>, Veronica Ayora Estevan <veronicaa@microsoft.com>

### Measure performance improvement with Copilot

- Measure the teams performance. Add Copilot and see the difference.
- Hackathon/lab - give goal and time box to different teams and compare between with and without Copilot

### Justify Copilot cost

Ho justify copilot cost follow this steps
1. calculate how many dev hours is $39. Lets say is XH
2. Using metric prove that developers are saving more than XH to justify license.

### Monitor billing

- Use Copilot Billing API to monitor and control the use of the Copilot Seats.

### Monitor good use of Copilot

- Use Copilot Usage API to detect trends and big differences between similar teams to trigger improvement/training actions to understand why of this trends.
